title: Cylinder Head - Inspection

body.body: Fully clean the surface of the cylinder head and check for damage and pitting of the combustion chambers.

Use a straight edge and feeler gauges to check the cylinder head face for warp, which could lead to gasket failure. Replace the cylinder head if warped beyond the flatness limit. For specifications refer to
Inspect the valve guides for damage or wear.
If you find a valve guide is worn beyond the service limit, the complete cylinder head must be renewed. For specifications refer to
Check the camshaft drive chain rubbing blades. Renew them if worn or damaged.
Make sure all traces of fluid (for example: coolant, oil) are removed from the threaded holes in the crankcase.
If there is any fluid in any of the threaded holes, severe crankcase damage could result from hydraulic locking of head bolts during assembly of the engine.
